config.question: What was the impact of U.S. entry into the war on the course of World War I?

choices.content: Americans injected hope into the Allies and helped turn German troops back along the western front, forcing them to call for an armistice.
American forces routed Germany and Austria on the eastern front and freed troops to join the fight in the West.
The declaration of war itself daunted the Germans, causing them to abandon their positions in western Europe and sign an armistice.
The American military contribution to the war was insignificant and made only a psychological impact on the Central Powers.

answer_3.response: The American contribution, although small compared to the enormous costs to European nations, was vital. Fresh, enthusiastic American troops raised Allied morale; they helped turn the tide at a crucial point in the war.
